block-definition.comment: returns a frequency analysis of the argument list, represented as a two-column table, where the first column contains the unique values and the second column their occurrences

pt:uma ordenação de _ com critério _ ca:$flash ordena _ per _
pt:o histograma de _ entre _ e _ com intervalo _ ca:histograma de _ des de: _ fins: _ interval: _

custom-block.s: fill %l key: %repRing from: %n to: %n interval: %repRing with: %repRing

block-definition.comment: Connect to a broker The options are not required but can be filled if needed 1. username (some brokers need this) 2. password (some brokers need this) 3. keepalive (default time is 60 seconds but some brokers need a shorter time) 4. connection callback (ringed set of scripts to be run when connection is made or remade) Note: The connection callback doesn''t have to be the 4th option - it just has to be the last (or only) option. ADVANCED: The brokers offered in the menu are accessed using default ports and basepaths (if needed). If accessing other brokers, the complete urls should be formed like this: siteURL:port/basepath e.g mqtt.eclipseprojects.io:443/mqtt
Publish a message to an MQTT broker The options are not required but can be filled if needed 1. qos (quality of service 0,1 or 2) 2. retain flag (boolean)

block-definition.s: $cloudOutline MQTT subscribe to %'broker' topic %'topic' $nl on each message run %'callback'
block-definition.comment: Subscribe to a topic on a broker Make sure you have already run an MQTT connect block before using this one You should add a script to be run inside he grey ring. It will be run each time a message is received If you click on the arrow on the grey ring twice, you can use #1 and #2 inside your script. #1 will contain the received payload #2 will contain the received topic name

custom-block.s: $cloudOutline MQTT subscribe to %s topic %s %br on each message run %cmdRing

block-definition.s: $cloudOutline MQTT request %'broker' topic %'topic' $nl response topic %'rtopic' payload %'payload' $nl on response run %'callback'

custom-block.s: $cloudOutline MQTT subscribe to %s topic %s %br on each message run %cmdRing

block-definition.s: $cloudOutline MQTT example response reporter payload %'payload' topic %'topic'
$cloudOutline MQTT request %'broker' topic %'topic' $nl response topic %'rtopic' payload %'payload' $nl $options-1-192-192-192 %'options'
block-definition.comment: The response topic should be a unique value for each call e.g. use timer There is only 1 option at present 1. Timeout value - default is 3 seconds

custom-block.s: $cloudOutline MQTT subscribe to %s topic %s %br on each message run %cmdRing

block-definition.translations: pt:a resposta a _ de _ enviando _ e cabeçalhos _

block-definition.comment: Reports a three-item list containing the latitude and longitude of the user, and the precision of the measurements. Works only if the user allows snap.berkeley.edu access to location data. Some browsers also require an HTTPS connection to Snap!.
